document.text: The 30th Annual Southside Area FFA Forestry Judging Contest will be held in the Appomattox-Buckingham State Forest, Saturday, October 16. Winners from the five sub-re gions of the area will participate. Contest plots will be selected and officially scored by Warren Taylor and David Smith of the Virginia Division of Forestry. W. C. Dudley, area supervisor of agricultural education, is in charge of local arrangements. The contest is co-sponsored

I deeply appreciate the confi dence of the Towncitizens, and the cooperation of Town officials and employees. Due to reasons of health this is to announce that I will not be a candidate in the forthcoming Town election. Wfth every wish for the continued growth of our Town and with thanks for your friendship, Respectfully, Mrs. Earle P. Robinson

document.text: they are shaken off the picked up by a harveeter, and ont to Mate- owned nurseries in either New Kent or Augusta. The subsequ ent seedlings are sold to anyone in the Mate. Although the seed orchard is not yet self-sufficient. Stanley was optimistic that it would be in the near future. He pointed out that the project was relatively new at seven years old and thus needed more time to become economically inde pendent. Presently, the seed orchard is partially subsidized by state and federal grahta. Overall, with its sale of tim ber to woodcutters and its lum ber and post production, the lo cal Division of Forestry ia self- funding. Included in its gross budget of 340,000 is  one-quarter allocation that is given annually to the five counties under the lcaj Divisions jurisdiction. Each countys exact share is deter mined according to the timber cut in forests of the county. In August of 1974, the Virginia Division of Forestry presente! Appomattox County with 13, 154.57, which was Appomat toxs portion of the one-fourth gross proceeds from timber cut from tiie Appomattox-Bucking- ham State Forest. The three operations of the Appomattox-Buckingham For estry Center, forest manage ment, timber and post produc tion, and tree improvement

document.text: Sealed bids for the purchase of Umber marked for cutting on the designated portion of Appomat- tox-Buckingham State Forest located one mile southeast of Appomattox-Buckingham Forest Headquarters on east side of Route 460, in area of about 62 acres, will be received by the State Forester, Box 3347, Uni versity Station, Charlottesville, Virginia, until 200 p.m. on Mon day, April 6, 1964, at which date and hour all bids will be opened in his office. The timber consists of 39G.424 Bd. Ft. Full particulars, including pro posal form and sample contract, may be secured from the State Forester, or from J. C. Hayes. Forest Superintendent, Cumber land, Va. Appointments may be made with Mr. Hayes to inspect the area and timber, either by mail, by telephoning him at HY 2-2011, Cumberland, Virginia, or by contacting him at his office. 2-20-4t
